intro: Ceropegia pedunculata, commonly known as the string of hearts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia pedunculata is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
